Read YAML Sample Data and Metrics

Source: R/readYAML.R
readYAML.Rd

Read YAML Sample Data and Metrics

readYAMLSampleData(file)

readYAMLSampleMetrics(file)

Arguments

file

string. File path to bcbio project-summary.yaml.

Value

data.frame.

Note

Metrics are only generated for a standard RNA-seq run with aligned counts. Fast RNA-seq mode with lightweight counts (pseudocounts) doesn't output the same metrics into the YAML.

See also

Other Read Functions: readDataVersions, readLog, readProgramVersions, readSampleData, readTx2gene

Examples

file <- "http://bcbiobase.seq.cloud/project-summary.yaml"
readYAMLSampleData(file) %>% glimpse()
#> Reading sample metadata from YAML
#> Observations: 4
#> Variables: 5
#> $ sampleName  <fct> group1_1, group1_2, group2_1, group2_2
#> $ description <fct> group1_1, group1_2, group2_1, group2_2
#> $ genomeBuild <fct> mm10, mm10, mm10, mm10
#> $ group       <fct> ctrl, ctrl, ko, ko
#> $ samRef      <fct> /groups/bcbio/bcbio_dev/genomes/Mmusculus/mm10/seq/mm10.f…
readYAMLSampleMetrics(file) %>% glimpse()
#> Reading sample metrics from YAML
#> Observations: 4
#> Variables: 16
#> $ averageInsertSize             <dbl> 0, 0, 0, 0
#> $ duplicates                    <dbl> 0, 0, 0, 0
#> $ duplicationRateOfMapped       <dbl> 0.5574675, 0.5890465, 0.5772400, 0.5828…
#> $ exonicRate                    <dbl> 0.8590, 0.8820, 0.8632, 0.8713
#> $ intergenicRate                <dbl> 0.0663, 0.0599, 0.0661, 0.0635
#> $ intronicRate                  <dbl> 0.0747, 0.0581, 0.0707, 0.0652
#> $ mappedPairedReads             <dbl> 0, 0, 0, 0
#> $ mappedReads                   <dbl> 22062337, 25852621, 25172084, 25100941
#> $ qualityFormat                 <fct> standard, standard, standard, standard
#> $ rrna                          <dbl> 42218.64, 48275.49, 38893.78, 40831.69
#> $ rrnaRate                      <dbl> 0.002069408, 0.001970088, 0.001665623, …
#> $ sequenceLength                <fct> 25-75, 25-75, 25-75, 25-75
#> $ sequencesFlaggedAsPoorQuality <dbl> 0, 0, 0, 0
#> $ totalReads                    <dbl> 22339941, 26168288, 25490090, 25399483
#> $ x5x3Bias                      <dbl> 1.01, 1.04, 1.00, 0.98
#> $ xGC                           <dbl> 48, 48, 47, 48
